thread.title: Crystal Ball: Dawgs have clear lead for elite OL
thread.title_full: Crystal Ball: Dawgs have clear lead for elite OL

title: Crystal Ball: Dawgs have clear lead for elite OL
text:
Manage Crystal Ball: Dawgs have clear lead for elite OL According to the 247Sports Crystal Ball, Georgia has jumped out to a big lead for one of the nation's top offensive linemen.   
Georgia is looking to add four offensive linemen in 2018 to go with the impressive group of six players it signed in 2017. With one already in the fold in Franklin (Franklin, Tenn.) offensive tackle Max Wray already in the fold, the Bulldogs appear to be in good shape with at least one more of their top targets. 
According to the 247Sports Crystal Ball, Georgia is out to a strong lead for Houston County offensive guard Trey Hill . UGA has all six predictions thus far. Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
Hill took an unofficial visit to UGA over the weekend and was in Athens for multiple games this fall. He is also former teammates with 2017 Georgia quarterback signee Jake Fromm . 
At 6-foot-4 325 pounds, Hill is the 43rd overall prospect in the 2018 class according to the industry-generated 247Sports Composite. He's also seen as the nation's No. 2 guard -- behind top UGA target and Peach State native Jamaree Salyer -- and as the fifth-ranked player in Georgia. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
